Articles.Content: To pass the time I made some Kerbals for spore...

I don\'t understand the middle picture, the top one is pretty cool, and the bottom one deserves cookies.

(:![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (:![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (:![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (:![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (:![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (:![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

EDIT: Dem smileys.

When my friends ask me what KSP is, I often say it\'s essentially what the space age of Spore could and should have been. That game had so much potential and was fun to play for about 10 hours. I\'ve spent far more time on KSP.

Me too. To explain the middle picture, its a city of Kerbals and the factory buildings on the right are VABs while the entertainment building is a cinema with a billboard and the habitation building is a small housing development with manicured vegetation, a bit like an armed forces / NASA housing complex... The town hall is of course mission control ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> When my friends ask me what KSP is, I often say it\'s essentially what the space age of Spore could and should have been. That game had so much potential and was fun to play for about 10 hours. I\'ve spent far more time on KSP.

Actually, just sit back and think for a moment, what would happen if you released approx. 15 million children into the world of rocket science.

I\'ll tell you what, they would all be stuck on their homeworld, save the crafty that can get things done. And the Spore forums? A warzone.

I\'m thinking about installing that POC again just to make the best Kerbal in the universe. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> I\'m thinking about installing that POC again just to make the best Kerbal in the universe. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Just a grammar nazi thing; there\'s only an accent on the second E. With it, it\'s pronounced 'ray-zu-may', when you really want it to be pronounced 'reh-zu-may'.
Also, I asked for Kerbals a while ago. Has anyone managed to make 'au naturel' ones?

> 
> Just a grammar nazi thing; there\'s only an accent on the second E. With it, it\'s pronounced 'ray-zu-may', when you really want it to be pronounced 'reh-zu-may'.
> 
> Also, I asked for Kerbals a while ago. **Has anyone managed to make 'au naturel' ones?**

Are you asking for naked Kerbals..

> 
> Are you asking for naked Kerbals..

Well, they aren\'t born with spacesuits on, are they?

> 
> Well, they aren\'t born with spacesuits on, are they?

I guess not. I think in their \'au naturel\' state they should have leaves covering their personal parts, it would be a good joke on their plant nature.

> 
> Well, they aren\'t born with spacesuits on, are they?

Those aren\'t spacesuits, they\'re peels. Like an orange peel with a window.
Hey Ping, what\'s up with you and Kerbals reproducing and being naked these past two days? LOL

> 
> Those aren\'t spacesuits, they\'re peels. Like an orange peel with a window.

Does that mean they\'re all sweet and juicy inside and if they\'re not peeled correctly they\'ll squirt citric acid in my eyes?

> 
> Hey Ping, what\'s up with you and Kerbals reproducing and being naked these past two days? LOL

He\'s Kerbally frustrated..

> 
> Well, they aren\'t born with spacesuits on, are they?

Perhaps they are evolved perfectly for making rockets and exploring space, and thus are born in pressure suits? I betcha didn\'t think of that one, did ya?

:-)

> 
> Perhaps they are evolved perfectly for making rockets and exploring space, and thus are born in pressure suits? I betcha didn\'t think of that one, did ya?
> 
> :-)

Well that would certainly fix [this problem](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10283.0).

> 
> Well that would certainly fix [this problem](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10283.0).

That probably has already been explained to you... It\'s right there in the comments. You\'re wrong... You\'re confused with pressure, which would be maintained artificially in a spacecraft. Gravity has nothing to do with it.

> 
> That probably has already been explained to you... It\'s right there in the comments. You\'re wrong... You\'re confused with pressure, which would be maintained artificially in a spacecraft. Gravity has nothing to do with it.

I know. I was being stupid. He was, and so was I. Get yer head out o\' the books, boy. Rustle some jimmies if you need to.

> 
> 'He was...'?

> 
> Perhaps they are evolved perfectly for making rockets and exploring space, and thus are born in pressure suits? I betcha didn\'t think of that one, did ya?
> 
> :-)
